SEARCH
Package com.app.numbers.utility.recursion

Interface NumberUtilityRecursion

public interface NumberUtilityRecursion
A utility interface providing various recursive methods for mathematical and array operations. Methods include exponentiation, and finding the maximum and minimum values in an array.

  • Method Summary

    Static Methods
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static long
    exponentiation(long x, int exponent)
    Calculates the result of raising a base number to a given exponent using recursion.
    static int
    getMax(int[] numbers)
    Finds the maximum value in an array of integers using recursion.
    static int
    getMin(int[] numbers)
    Finds the minimum value in an array of integers using recursion.

  • Method Details

    • exponentiation

      static long exponentiation(long x, int exponent)
      Calculates the result of raising a base number to a given exponent using recursion. This method performs exponentiation by squaring for efficiency.
      Parameters:
      x - The base number.
      exponent - The exponent to which the base number is raised. Must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      The result of x raised to the power of exponent.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the exponent is negative.

    • getMax

      static int getMax(int[] numbers)
      Finds the maximum value in an array of integers using recursion.
      Parameters:
      numbers - The array of integers. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      The maximum value found in the array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the array is null or empty.

    • getMin

      static int getMin(int[] numbers)
      Finds the minimum value in an array of integers using recursion.
      Parameters:
      numbers - The array of integers. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      The minimum value found in the array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the array is null or empty.
